alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Campbell; Grant; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, NORTHWESTERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, GRANT, CENTRAL PENDLETON AND SOUTH CENTRAL CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Dry Ridge, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Independence, Alexandria, Taylor Mill, Williamstown, Claryville, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights, Crestview, Mentor, Moscow, Neville, California, Mount Auburn, Stewartsville, Visalia, Atwood and Grants Lick. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 148 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
